title: Large-Scale Instructional Design Practice for Analyzing Elementary Students' Software Preferences

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Educational Technology Theory and PBL Project Experience
context.additional_context: Learners conduct software preference analysis projects targeting elementary students in educational settings and explore ways to improve instructional design based on research findings

learning_goals: They can explain the procedures for designing and implementing a survey on elementary students' software preferences.
They can evaluate and analyze science education software based on the drill-and-practice instructional method.
They can write a project report proposing instructional improvement plans using learning data.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
